page.title: 07Converted Buildings
page.content: There are a lot of oast houses in our area.Some are being changed or have already been changed into private homes.However some of the oasts are still used today for drying hops. Other buildings undergoing conversion include stables,barns,offices,and even a chapel,a castle and a brewery.Most of these places I have mentioned are being converted into private houses. Hop picking used to be very popular in our area,so they had a lot of oast houses.When hop picking became less popular the oasts were converted into private homes for people to live in. The chapel has been changed into a house.The brewery is being changed into some flats.Hadlow Castle used to be a folly ,but a man bought it and it is now used as a home. Faulkners Farm is a good example of a converted oast and has six roundels.
